title: 2026 Winter Olympics open amid geopolitical and climate tensions
subhead: The Winter Olympics, which begin on Friday, promise a spectacle of athletic achievement, emotion and entertainment broadcast worldwide. Yet its organizers must now prove that their dispersed venue model is viable.

title: French government expects resistance from Jack Lang after summons to explain Epstein ties
Jean-Luc Mélenchon courts small business owners
France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
subhead: According to Paris, the Syrian authorities' agreement with Kurdish forces challenges the structure of the fight against the jihadist group in Syria and Iraq. On Thursday, France's foreign minister traveled to Damascus, Baghdad and Erbil.

title: French judge and her mother freed after a cryptocurrency-linked abduction
subhead: The two women were kidnapped on Wednesday night. The judge's partner is an active investor in the cryptocurrency sector.

title: Six Nations: France holds promises with decisive victory against Ireland
subhead: The French, buoyed by the return of Antoine Dupont, convincingly defeated the Irish at the Stade de France (36-14). They have launched their title defense with panache.

title: UK inquiry further incriminates French rescue services in 2021 Channel shipwreck
subhead: The findings of a British public inquiry reveal that French rescue services on November 24, 2021, instructed an oil tanker to continue its course, even though it was likely the ship had located the distressed dinghy in which 31 people perished.

title: France detects Russia-linked Epstein smear attempt against Macron, says government source
EU tells TikTok to change its 'addictive' design or face fines
Canada, France open consulates in Greenland in show of support
Suspected former member of the Kosovo Liberation Army arrested for war crimes
Kimi Onoda, Japan's young minister likened to 'Joan of Arc,' courts the conservative electorate
Pretzels and Käseküeche: The comforting treasures of Alsatian cuisine
Ahmed Yousef, former Hamas official: 'We have lost everything, armed struggle has failed'
How Marine Le Pen changed her defense strategy
Secondhand market booms, challenging luxury industry

European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
Lore Baudrit, captain of France's Olympic women's hockey team: 'We train like pros, but don't get paid'
Foreign language learning holds strong against the AI wave
subhead: Artificial intelligence now translates both spoken and written language with ease and at lightning speed. Yet, it still lacks 'culture' and the human touch needed to free employees from mastering English – or any other foreign language – in the workplace.

title: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhead: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.

title: The US versus human rights
'Trump put liberal democracy in the crosshairs in 2025, he might pull the trigger in 2026'
'The US always promises to extract itself from Middle Eastern quagmires while continuing to get stuck knee-deep'
